items.descriptor: Evaluate how well user experience design is embedded into agile delivery practices
items.raw: UX Integration in Agile Evaluate how well user experience design is embedded into agile delivery practices

entries.descriptor: UX work is performed entirely upfront, separate from development iterations.
UX design is delivered to engineering as static documents without collaboration.
UX is consulted occasionally during development but not embedded in the team.
Design work is reviewed before implementation, but not continuously iterated with developers.
UX and engineering collaborate regularly during sprints, with shared goals and refinement cycles.
Design decisions are validated with users or customers before implementation begins.
UX designers attend team ceremonies like stand-ups and retrospectives.
Design, development, and research work in parallel with just-in-time alignment and feedback loops.
Prototypes and user feedback directly shape sprint backlog priorities.
UX and engineering have a shared definition of done, including accessibility and usability outcomes.
